question: When a level 1 Druid/Cleric dies, what kind of saving throw, if any, do they make?
answer: When a character or monster that is reduced to 0 hit points is not killed outright, it must make death saving throws. Unlike other saving throws, death saving throws are not tied to any ability score. The character must roll a d20. A roll of 10 or higher is a success. Otherwise, it's a failure.
rules: Combat > Damage and Healing > Dropping to 0 Hit Points > Death Saving Throws
rules_explanation: If a character is reduced to 0 hit points and isn't killed outright, the character must make death saving throws.
